intro: Rinorea somalensis, commonly known as the Somali Rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
